question: NISAR Synthetic Aperture Radar which was making news recently, is a collaboration of ISRO with which space agency?
explanation:
ISRO has recently completed the development of a Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR), which is capable of producing high-resolution images.
NASA-ISRO SAR (NISAR) is a collaboration for a dual-frequency L and S-band SAR for a joint earth observation satellite mission. It will be the first satellite mission to use two different radar frequencies to observe the earth surface.
